results.title: The Lesser half
results.creator_credit: Bryn Brooks, Suzanne Davies and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: This film explores how far the position of women in the labour market reflects the position of women in the home, and discusses the status of women’s work in the home. Three couples are interviewed regarding their views on women working and how it affects their own relationship and family. Also included in the discussions is a woman journalist who specialises in women’s problems. Housework is looked at and evaluated as if it were paid work.

results.title: The Invisible planet
results.creator_credit: Mauri Goldberg, National Educational Television and Prism Productions
results.brief_description: This film covers a twenty-four year study of Barnard’s Star, the star nearest to the earth observable from the northern hemisphere, by Doctor Peter Van De Kamp. It also shows the discovery of what is claimed to be the first planet to be found outside our solar system. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: Making the desert green
results.creator_credit: Stanley Croner, Warren Brown, Warren Hall and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: This film illustrates how water has helped change the dry salty Coachella Valley in southern California into a rich farming region. It shows how land use has changed, the development of the irrigation system, the movement of water to the farms and how an underground drainage system rids the soil of excess salt.

results.title: Spirit of the Renaissance
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Explores the intellectual and artistic climate of Florence during the fourteenth and fifteenth centuries using scenes from the daily life of a contemporary Florentine. Discusses the lives and influence of Petrarca, Alberti, Leonardo Da Vinci and Savonarola. Film uses dramatization, contemporary art material with modern day footage of Florence and Rome.

results.title: Newspaper story. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Thomas Smith and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: This is a comprehensive documentation of a day in the life of a large American metropolitan newspaper, the “Los Angeles Times”. Included are roles of political and sports reporters, cartoonists, photographers, music critics, recipe testers. Advertising layouts, editing processes, proof reading. Computer techniques in type-setting and printing are also shown.

results.title: Flatland
results.creator_credit: Edwin Abbot, Harvard University and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: An animated mathematical allegory by Edwin Abbot about a square who discovers the third dimension, but is jailed by the two-dimensional inhabitants of Flatland when he preaches multidimensionality. Also offers a universal social commentary on social structures and values. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: Any empty space
results.brief_description: Records the evolution of the Northwestern University Mime Company from its initial orientation to its first performance. The company consists of students who had no previous training in the art. The film also reveals the kinds of mental and physical discipline demanded by mime as an art form. No other credits available.

results.title: Sir Johnny-on-the-spot
results.brief_description: A marionette show set on the mythical Isle of Dragonia. Princess Moonglow has to choose a dragon to ride in the grand parade. Star is a beautiful but lazy and conceited dragon and his brother Spot is modest and punctual, but quite ordinary in appearance. She must select the first one she sees at sunrise. Encourages ideas about promptness, reliability and modesty. Suitable for middle primary level.

results.title: Uncle Smiley goes up the river
results.creator_credit: Jim Burroughs, Joe Sutherin and Learning Corporation of America

results.title: Uncle Smiley goes recycling
results.creator_credit: Jim Burroughs, Joe Sutherin and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Introduces the term “recycling” to children and provides information about different recycling possibilities. Uncle Smiley and the children take their waste collection to a recycling depot where it is sorted prior to re-use. Suitable for middle and upper primary level.
